intro: Myosotis scabra, commonly known as the rough mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, oval-shaped leaves and small, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its flowers bloom in early summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Myosotis scabra is often found in rocky or disturbed soils and is relatively easy to cultivate in gardens with proper moisture conditions.
